title: Zeta-Life: Functional Identity Attractors in Multi-Agent Systems
description: Research framework investigating functional identity attractors in multi-agent systems using Riemann zeta function mathematics. Implements IPUESA methodology for operationalizing self-like behavior through progressive falsification.
notes: This software implements the SYNTH-v2 configuration that achieves 6/6 self-evidence criteria within a narrow stress regime (3.9× damage multiplier ± 5%). Key contribution: demonstrates that self-like functional identity is achievable in artificial systems, but requires specific mechanisms and calibrated conditions.
